Configuration.CounterName: Total Failed BAM Events During Flush

DisplayString.Name: Host Throttling: High in-process message count over time
DisplayString.Description: The state of the in-process message count over time.

DisplayString.Name: Over Threshold
DisplayString.Description: The average value over a series of samples exceeded the monitor's threshold.

DisplayString.Name: Under Threshold
DisplayString.Description: The average value over a series of samples is below the monitor's threshold.

DisplayString.Name: A high in-process message count has been detected on average over a series of samples.
Host Throttling: High database size
DisplayString.Description: If this state is in error then it indicates that at least one of the BizTalk server processes on the affected computer is being throttled for significant periods because of high database size.

DisplayString.Name: Over Threshold
DisplayString.Description: The average value over a series of samples exceeded the monitor's threshold.

DisplayString.Name: Under Threshold
DisplayString.Description: The average value over a series of samples is below the monitor's threshold

DisplayString.Name: One of the BizTalk Server processes in the affected computer is being throttled for significant periods because of high database size exceeding the threshold.
Host Throttling: High process memory
DisplayString.Description: This error indicates that at least one of the BizTalk server processes in the affected computer is being throttled for significant periods because of high process memory.

DisplayString.Name: Over Threshold
DisplayString.Description: The average value over a series of samples exceeded the monitor's threshold.

DisplayString.Name: Under Threshold
DisplayString.Description: The average value over a series of samples is below the monitor's threshold.

DisplayString.Name: One of the BizTalk server processes in the affected computer is being throttled for significant periods because of high process memory size exceeding the threshold.
Host Throttling: High thread count
DisplayString.Description: This error indicates that at least one of the BizTalk server processes in the affected computer is being throttled for significant periods on account of high thread counts.

DisplayString.Name: Over Threshold
DisplayString.Description: The average value over a series of samples exceeded the monitor's threshold.

DisplayString.Name: Under Threshold
DisplayString.Description: The average value over a series of samples is below the monitor's threshold.

DisplayString.Name: One of the BizTalk server processes in the affected computer is being throttled for significant periods on account of high thread counts exceeding the threshold.

DisplayString.Name: Applications State View
DisplayString.Description: This is a dashboard view that displays the health of a BizTalk application. The health of BizTalk application depends on the health of its constituent artifacts such as Orchestrations, Send Port Group, Send Port, Receive Port, and Receive Location. The Details View pane provides the properties of the hosted BizTalk application.

DisplayString.Name: BizTalk Application Service Availability Monitor
DisplayString.Description: Checks that the BizTalk application service (BTSNTSvc.exe) is running

DisplayString.Name: Not Running
DisplayString.Description: This is the Monitor State Value for Not Running.

DisplayString.Name: Running
DisplayString.Description: This is the Monitor State Value for Running.

DisplayString.Name: One of the BizTalk application services is not running
Application Service State View
DisplayString.Description: Displays the health of all host instances in a BizTalk group.

DisplayString.Name: Groups State View
DisplayString.Description: This is a dashboard view that displays the health of a BizTalk group. The health of a BizTalk group depends on the health of BizTalk hosts and BizTalk applications. The Details View pane provides the properties of the BizTalk group.

DisplayString.Name: Deployment State View
DisplayString.Description: This is a dashboard view that displays the health of a BizTalk deployment group. The health of the BizTalk deployment group depends on the health of its constituent runtime server components such as BAM Role, Rule Engine Role, BizTalk Run-time Role and BizTalk Host. The Details View pane provides the properties of the BizTalk deployment group.

DisplayString.Name: BizTalk Group Deployment Dependent On BAM Role
DisplayString.Description: Availability state of the BizTalk group deployment depends on the availability of BAM.

DisplayString.Name: BizTalk Group Deployment Dependent On BizTalk Host
DisplayString.Description: Availability state of the BizTalk group deployment depends on the availability of all hosts belonging to it.

DisplayString.Name: BizTalk Group Deployment Dependent On Server Role
DisplayString.Description: Availability state of the BizTalk group deployment depends on the availability of all server roles belonging to it.

DisplayString.Name: BizTalk Group Dependent On BizTalk Application
DisplayString.Description: Availability state of the BizTalk group depends on the availability of all applications belonging to it.

DisplayString.Name: BizTalk Group Dependent On BizTalk Host
DisplayString.Description: Availability state of the BizTalk group depends on the availability of all hosts belonging to it.

DisplayString.Name: BizTalk Host Availability Monitor
DisplayString.Description: This checks for the availability of all host instances (BTSNTSvc.exe) for the BizTalk host.

DisplayString.Name: BizTalkHost Error
BizTalkHost Success
BizTalkHost Warning
BizTalk Server: Availability Monitor raised an Error on BizTalk Host
DisplayString.Description: The required number of host instances are not running for this host.

DisplayString.Name: Hosts State View
DisplayString.Description: This is a dashboard view that displays the health of a BizTalk host. The health of a BizTalk host depends on the health of all its host instances. The Details View pane provides the properties of the BizTalk host.

DisplayString.Name: BizTalk Host Monitor Error
DisplayString.Description: Diagnostic task that can be run to see details about stopped host instances when monitor state is Error.

DisplayString.Name: BizTalk Host Monitor Warning
DisplayString.Description: Diagnostic task that can be run to see details about stopped host instances when monitor state is Warning.

DisplayString.Name: Hosts State View
DisplayString.Description: This is a dashboard view that displays the health of a BizTalk host. The health of a BizTalk host depends on the health of all its host instances. The Details View pane provides the properties of the BizTalk host.

DisplayString.Name: BizTalk Host Availability Dependent On Application Service
DisplayString.Description: Availability state of BizTalk host depends on the availability of its instances.

DisplayString.Name: BizTalk Host Performance Dependent On Application Service
DisplayString.Description: Performance state of BizTalk host depends on the performance of its instances.

DisplayString.Name: Run-Time Role State View
DisplayString.Description: This is a dashboard view that displays the servers that have BizTalk runtime installed and configured. The health of a BizTalk run-time role depends on the health of its components such as SSO service, SSO database, host instances (btsntsvc.exe), management database, message box database and tracking database. The Details View pane provides the properties of the run-time role.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This Management Pack is designed for the BizTalk Server contains the monitors, rules and views which provide an extensible way to control this application.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: Load this management pack while or after loading the Microsoft.BizTalk.Server.2016.Library and Microsoft.BizTalk.Server.2016.Discovery for the BizTalk Server.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: TDDS failed to transfer tracking data to BAM Primary Import database.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This commonly happens in the following situations:

maml:listItem.maml:para: BAM Primary Import database can not be located.
BAM definition is not deployed.
The tracking data is badly-formatted (e.g., duplicated ID or wrong column names)

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: See the error records logged to TDDS_FailedTracking table in BAM Primary Import database, and

maml:listItem.maml:para: Verify if TDDS points to the correct BAM Primary Import database by checking the TDDS_Destinations table in BizTalk Management database.
Verify if BAM definition is deployed by checking the BAM Primary Import database.
Verify tracking data has the acceptable content and format by comparing the tracking data to the columns of the deployed BAM definition table in BAM Primary Import database

maml:section.maml:para: Not Available

maml:section.maml:title: External
maml:section.maml:para: Not Available

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Incorrect logon account used for connecting to Primary Import database.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The BAM Web services account may not have permissions to the BAM Primary Import database in the SQL server.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Try connecting to the SQL server using SQL client tools and the BAM WS user credentials to verify if the user account has access privileges to connect to the BAM Primary Import database. You can determine the BAM WS user account by running the BizTalk Configuration tool and the account will be in the BAM Portal section. You can also use the BizTalk configuration tool to change the BAM WS account.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Unexpected error in the BAM Portal or in the BAM Management web service.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: Any unexpected error in the BAM portal or the BAM Query web service can cause this. In most cases this error requires immediate attention.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Please check the event log on the portal machine for more detailed error message. Also, tracing can be enabled in the BAM Portal and BAM Query web service web.config files to further diagnose the problem.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: BAM Interceptors Event Provider: ERROR - Invalid IC Schema Error

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: BAM Interceptors definition with Invalid IC Schema.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Check Alert detail and KB for further assistance.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Cube DTS has not been run.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: BAM definition with cubes is deployed. However, cube DTS packages are not run to process tracking data.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Run cube DTS packages in SQL Server to process tracking data.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Error encountered on connecting to BAM Primary Import Database.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This may happen due to problems with the BAM configuration.

maml:listItem.maml:para: Investigate your BAM configuration and verify whether the correct SQL server is referenced.
Investigate whether the databases exist in the referenced SQL server and verify connectivity to the referenced SQL server.
Verify the SQL server machine and database names in the bm.exe.config and the BAM web services web.config files.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The most common cause of this error is loss of network connectivity to the database server.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Please verify that SQL Server can be accessed with SQL client tools from the current machine.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Check Alert detail and KB for further assistance.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: In a scenario involving multiple BAM Primary Import databases, a referenced BAM Primary Import database could not be found.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This may be because of a bad configuration or due to loss of network connectivity to a SQL server.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Please investigate your BAM configuration with BAM Manager (bm.exe get-references), and verify if referenced databases and SQL Servers are correctly specified. Please investigate if all the involved referenced databases and SQL servers are available.

maml:section.maml:para: BAM Portal encountered internal server exception.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: Unexpected error in the BAM Portal or in the BAM Query web service.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Please check the event log on the portal machine for more detailed error message. Also, tracing can be enabled in the BAM Portal and BAM Query web service web.config files to further diagnose the problem.

maml:section.maml:para: This event is triggered by a user request from BAM portal.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions

maml:section.maml:para: This may happen if the service hosting POP3 adapter goes down in the middle of processing a message especially if multiple BizTalk services are polling the same receive location.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Resolve any well-known problems with the associated BizTalk service.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The "REASON" in the error message includes: Receive Pipeline, Source, Receive Location and Reason. You may need to take appropriate corrective action based on this reason. Typical failures are due to malformed messages, messages not conforming to a deployed schema, etc

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: The "REASON" in the error message includes: Receive Pipeline, Source, Receive Location and Reason. You may need to take appropriate corrective action based on this reason.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This error indicates that there was a problem executing the Receive Pipeline. The Receive Location on which the Pipeline executed is associated with HTTP adapter. This rule is meant to capture Pipeline execution errors if the inbound message is not suspended based on your HTTP Receive Location configuration.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The causes are same as any Pipeline failure - invalid formats, schema mismatch, invalid certificates, etc.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Remove the causes for Pipeline failure.

maml:section.maml:para: This error may happen because of different reasons. The error details are provided in the event for additional troubleshooting information.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: A routing failure was encountered on a message that was part of an interchange. The message has been suspended.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The reasons for this type of error are similar to any routing failure. Message properties did not match the corresponding subscription.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Investigate this in the same manner as a normal routing failure. Verify that message properties are as expected in relation to the intended subscription(s).

maml:section.maml:para: BizTalk Adapter for Windows Sharepoint Services failed to archive a processed message.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: Windows Sharepoint Services(WSS) is not transactional. If the adapter fails to mark a message as deleted in WSS, this error is written in the event log.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: The event log entry contains information and necessary steps to resolve this issue.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The error message contains the name of the receive adapter and the error code ("HRESULT") as reported by the adapter.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Resolution is adapter specific. You may need to contact your adapter vendor.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: BizTalk Adapter for Windows Sharepoint Services failed to mark a message as un-marked or eligible for re-submission.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: BizTalk Sharepoint adapter marks a message as being processed and then tries to submit it to BizTalk. If BizTalk submit fails, the adapter will try to unmark the message so that its processed next time. If the un-mark operation fails, this error is written in the event log.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: The event log entry contains information and necessary steps to resolve this issue.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This error indicates registration of an adapter by BizTalk runtime failed. This implies the functionality of this adapter may not be available for this BizTalk Host Instance.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The most common situation is HTTP and SOAP adapters are hosted under the same IIS Application Pool.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: If HTTP and SOAP adapters are hosted within the same IIS Application Pool, create separate Application Pools to host the different adapters.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: ERROR - An attempt to connect to a BizTalk database failed.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: An error has been encountered attempting to connect to a database. The database server may not be available on the network.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Verify that SQL Server instance can be accessed with SQL client tools from the BizTalk machine, and verify the Host Instance service's account credentials have the necessary access to the database.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The server associated with the Send Port HTTP URI location is not accessible.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The HTTP server unavailable or there may be network connectivity problems. If the system is accessible then there could be security related issues as well.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Ensure that the remote HTTP server is available. One possible check is to use an internet browser to confirm the availability of the HTTP server. If a proxy server has been specified for the send transport/send handler confirm that it is reachable. Lastly if the remote server requires authentication, but the credentials are not supplied or supplied credentials are invalid. If using HTTPS URL, the server certificate is not there in Enterprise Trust or Trusted Root certificate store of BizTalk NT service account or the local machine store.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The Windows service associated with a BizTalk Host Instance has stopped.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This may happen if the service has encountered errors from which it failed to recover. Please check dependencies of BizTalk service.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Please investigate if the services on which the BizTalk service depends are running.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: In a request-response communication pattern, each response message has a corresponding request message. A response message was received without a corresponding initial request message.

maml:listItem.maml:para: The host has recycled and the subscription for the response message was lost.
The response came too late and the initial request message has been NACKed
Identify the application using the message type for the response message.
Investigate your application scenario to identify and isolate the senders and receivers involved in this co-relation.
Look for potential causes of timeouts.
Investigate and prevent host process recycles.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This error indicates that the FILE transport Receive Adapter is suspending an inbound message.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: There are a variety of causes for this Event Log error message. The most common reason for suspending an inbound message is not finding subscriptions for the message. Other causes are failures in the inbound Pipeline. The error message contains the following details to aid in debugging this: Adapter, Receive Location, Receive Location URI and details of the error.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: For every suspended message:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Check if there is a subscription for the message.
Check if the destination Send Port or Orchestration is enlisted.
Check if there is a Schema deployed for the message.
If this is an encrypted message, check if the decryption certificate is configured and available.
Check if the custom Pipeline components configured correctly.
If any of those actions found a problem then fix it and resume message.
If none of those actions help then the error is possibly caused by the message payload.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: Not Available

maml:section.maml:title: Additional
maml:section.maml:para: Not Available

maml:section.maml:title: External
maml:section.maml:para: Not Available

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: A failure occurred while initializing the HTTP receive adapter.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This can happen when system resources are too low or if there is a problem with the IIS application pool account.

maml:listItem.maml:para: Check system resources. If they are too low, consider ways to free up resources by stopping some running processes or restarting the machine.
Check the event log and IIS logs for suspicious error messages.
Try restarting the IIS application pool and watching for any event log error messages.
Verify user credentials. The user credentials associated with the application pool may not belong to the correct groups.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This error indicates that the POP3 transport receive adapter is suspending an inbound message.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: There are a variety of causes for this Event Log error message. The most common reason for suspending an inbound message is not finding subscriptions for the message. Other causes are failures in the inbound Pipeline or MIME processing failures via the adapter. The error message contains the following details to aid in debugging this: Adapter, Receive Location, Receive Location URI and details of the error.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: For every suspended message:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Check if there is a subscription for the message.
Check if the destination Send Port or Orchestration is enlisted.
Check if there is a Schema deployed for the message.
If this is an encrypted message, check if the decryption certificate is configured and available.
Check if the custom Pipeline components configured correctly.
If any of those actions found a problem then fix it and resume message.
If none of those actions help then the error is possibly caused by the message payload.

maml:section.maml:para: You can also turn off MIME decoding off to view the original inbound message into BizTalk to check for payload problems.

maml:section.maml:para: Not Available

maml:section.maml:title: External
maml:section.maml:para: Not Available

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: POP3 Receive adapter does not have the correct credentials for the specified POP3 server.

maml:listItem.maml:para: The user name and password combination configured for the POP3 Receive Location is not correct.
Certain POP3 servers might give authentication errors if the mailbox is locked on the server. This typically happens if the same account is currently logged on to the server.
Server doesnt support the configured authentication scheme (e.g. the authentication scheme configured is NTLM, but server doesnt support this)
Verify the user name and password is correct.
Check the status of the mailbox and ensure that it is not locked.

maml:section.maml:para: The "REASON" in the error message includes: Send Pipeline, Source, Send Port and Reason. You may need to take appropriate corrective action based on this reason. Typical failures are due to malformed messages, messages not conforming to a deployed schema, etc

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: The "REASON" in the error message, includes: Send Pipeline, Source and Reason. You will need to take appropriate corrective action based on this reason.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This general error indicates that a transport transmit adapter is suspending an outgoing message.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: There are a variety of causes for this type of message and the eventlog error message contains the following information to aid in debugging this: Adapter, Destination URL and Details.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: View the application event log error message and take appropriate corrective action based on the details. For every suspended message:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Test if the destination URL is available. For e.g. file shares or http Uri s may be unavailable.
Verify that host service account has access to URIs for e.g. file shares or http virtual directories.
Verify explicit credentials used for authentication with destination URL such as file shares are correct.
If XML or FlatFile Pipeline is used on the Send Port check if the Schema for the message is deployed.
If SMIME component is used check if the encryption/signature cert is specified and available.
Check if the custom Pipeline components are configured correctly.
If none of those actions help then the error is possibly caused by message payload.

maml:section.maml:para: If any of the above actions led to finding a problem, then fix the problem and resume message in BizTalk administration console.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This error indicates that a Receive Location is shutting down due to an adapter specific error.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The error message contains the specific Receive Location and the details as reported by the adapter.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: View the adapter specific error as posted in the eventlog error message and take action to correct the specific error. Additionally, the BizTalk administrator will have to re-enable the Receive Location which has been shut down. This can be done using the BizTalk Server Administration Console.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: A stored procedure call failed. The name of the stored procedure and the SQL error code are displayed.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This is usually due to BizTalk runtime encountering problems on stored procedure calls during processing. SQL server instance associated with the call may not be available or there may be timeouts due to network connectivity issues.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Verify that the SQL Server is functioning properly - this can be done by viewing the SQL error code and correcting that condition. Additionally, you may need to open the BizTalk Administration console and resume the messages that have been suspended.

maml:section.maml:para: Not Available

maml:section.maml:title: Additional
maml:section.maml:para: Not Available

maml:section.maml:title: External
maml:section.maml:para: Not Available

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: A BizTalk Host Instance service has gone to stopped state unexpectedly. The windows service is marked with start-up type "automatic" and is expected to be running all the time.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: A BizTalk Host Instance service may be in a stopped state unexpectedly because of various reasons. Typically the reasons are: password of the service account associated with the Host Instance have expired or BizTalk Windows group membership for the service account have been changed.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Attempt to start the BizTalk Windows service from the Service Control Manager. Check the application event log and the system event log for additional events that may have more information on the type of the failure.

maml:listItem.maml:para: Verify that the credentials of the service account have not expired.
Verify that the service account is authorized as indicated by BizTalk security documentation.
Verify that the services on which BizTalk service depends are running or can start.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This is a generic warning for different causes. There will be other application event log entries with additional detail about the error.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Enable this rule to monitor intermittent problems and to target adapter specific problems.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The SQL agent job for backing up BizTalk databases has failed. It is critical to have the backup job running successfully to ensure that you can recover from database server failure.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: Please ensure that the SQL Agent is running with the correct credentials. Please check backup location for disk space issues.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Verify job configuration. This job must be running successfully all the time.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This error indicates that the BizTalk Messaging Engine failed to get the configuration information from the BizTalk configuration database.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The most common cause of this error is network connectivity to either the SSO database or the BizTalk configuration database.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Verify connectivity to the SSO database or the configuration database. Additionally, verify that the credentials(appropriate Windows group memberships) on the Host Instance service account is valid. If this is an isolated adapter (HTTP, SOAP) verify the credentials of the account running the IIS application pool process.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This error indicates that the FTP transport receive adapter is suspending an inbound message.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: There are a variety of causes for this event log error message. The most common reason for suspending an inbound message is not finding subscriptions for the message. Other causes are failures in the inbound Pipeline. The error message contains the following details to aid in debugging this: Adapter, Receive Location, Receive Location URI and details of the error.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: For every suspended message:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Check if there is a subscription for the message.
Check if the destination Send Port or Orchestration is enlisted.
Check if there is a Schema deployed for the message.
If this is an encrypted message, check if the decryption certificate is configured and available.
Check if the custom Pipeline components configured correctly.
If any of those actions found a problem then fix it and resume message.
If none of those actions help then the error is possibly caused by the message payload.

maml:section.maml:title: External

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This error indicates that the Enterprise Single Sign-On service is unavailable and could not be contacted to retrieve configuration data.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The SSO server may be down or connectivity to the SSO server may have been lost.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Verify that the SSO service is functioning properly and that connectivity to the SSO server is established.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This error indicates that one of the BizTalk sub-services failed to start on an attempt to start the BizTalk service.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: During a BizTalk service start, BizTalk starts up a number of sub-services within the BizTalk process which perform various kinds of processing. These are Endpoint Manager(EPM), MSMQT, Tracking Data Decoding Service(TDDS). There are several possible causes of this error. Typical reasons are MSMQT sub-service failing to start as MSMQ is running on the same machine, problems with adapter assemblies, and other product binaries.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: An administrator is advised to view the event log messages immediately preceding this message from which will indicate a course of corrective action. After this corrective action it is required to restart the Host Instance. This can be done using the Microsoft BizTalk Server Administration Console.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This error indicates that the BizTalk Message Queuing (MSMQT) service failed to start.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: Windows Message Queuing services (MSMQ) is currently running on this computer. MSMQT and MSMQ cannot co-exist on the same machine.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Please disable Microsoft Message Queuing service and retry starting the BizTalk service.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This error indicates that the host instance failed to connect to the BizTalk configuration database.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The most common cause of this error is network connectivity to the configuration database, but another cause may be the permissions for the Host Instance service account on the SQL server instance(s) for BizTalk databases.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Verify the network connectivity to the configuration database and the permissions on the Host Instance service account to ensure they are accurate.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This error indicates that an inbound message file received is a READ-ONLY file, and thus cannot be processed by BizTalk Server.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This may be caused if the file READ-ONLY attribute has been set incorrectly by the sender. This may also be caused if the folder associated with a Receive Location does not have the right permissions set.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Verify that the file attributes are correct and the folder has the right permissions on it as specified by BizTalk security documentation.

maml:section.maml:para: Please investigate the application event log and system event log for additional information.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: This is an informational event.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This error indicates that there was a problem executing one or more Pipeline components.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: Pipeline components include Assemblers/Disassemblers, Encoders/Decoders, Parsers/Serializers, as well as any custom component. This error indicates problems with any of these components.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: The "REASON" in the error message, includes: Pipeline, Source and Reason. You will need to take appropriate corrective action based on this reason.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This error indicates that a Receive Location has encountered some problems with its configuration.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The most common causes for this error are: invalid URI, invalid credentials or invalid permissions associated with the Receive Location.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Correct the receive location's configuration (this can be done with a variety of tools: IIS MMC, BizTalk Administration Console, etc.) and verify the following list

maml:listItem.maml:para: credentials of the IIS application pool service account for isolated Host adapter.
user and password used by the file adapter to retrieve files from a network share.
verify permissions of the BizTalk Host Instance service account on the Receive Location URI.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This indicates an adapter failed to transmit an outbound message. This may happen because of various reasons for example a destination HTTP Uri is unavailable. Enable this rule to monitor intermittent problems with transmission.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: Intermittent transport problems - especially the destination server may not be available.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Automatic retries should enable recovery. Investigate underlying network issues and resolve them.

maml:section.maml:para: BizTalk Adapter for Windows Sharepoint Services failed to delete a processed message.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: Windows Sharepint Services(WSS) is not transactional. If the adapter fails to mark a message as deleted in WSS, this error is written in the event log.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: The event log entry contains information and necessary steps to resolve this issue.

maml:section.maml:para: A processing failure was encountered on a message that was part of an interchange. The message has been suspended.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The reasons for this are same as any kind of suspension associated with any inbound message processing failure - for e.g. Schema resolution failure, invalid formats, etc

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Query for the suspended message in the BizTalk Administration console and verify the properties associated with the message and the message data.

Fix the response message and ask client to retry
The client can either retry or have the suspended message delivered via other means to the client to avoid duplications.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: An inbound message failed to match existing subscriptions and was suspended.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The inbound message does not have expected properties to match a subscription or the subscription is not active. Another usual reason is a Send Port or an Orchestration not enlisted as required.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Verify the message properties and the associated Send Port/Orchestration filter properties. Verify if the Send Ports / Orchestrations are enlisted as required.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The SQL agent job for copying tracked messages has failed. It is critical to have the copy tracked messages job running successfully to ensure that you have consistent tracking archives.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: Please ensure that the SQL Agent is running with the correct credentials. Please verify the job parameters. If this job is failing consistently then tracked messages would get backlogged in the MessageBox database. This might result in creation of archives which do not contain message bodies related to the service instance information in the same archive.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Verify job configuration. This job must be running successfully all the time.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Ensure that the network share specified is correct and is available. Re-enable receive location after the problem is fixed.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This error indicates that the Receive Location specified has dropped the inbound message due to an authentication failure.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: On a Receive Port that requires authentication of the sender, the message sender could not be resolved to a known BizTalk Party. Many frequent occurrences of this type of error may indicate a potential security issue.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: You will need to decide upon the severity of this condition (a single case may mean an incorrectly formatted message, multiple cases may mean a security issue) and disable the Receive Location to minimize the distraction. Additionally, an administrator may want to investigate the incoming traffic to ensure that no security issues exist.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This usually happens if the associated Send Port has been deleted while message(s) bound for the Port were in a suspended state.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: The message cannot be routed as originally intended during message submission. Please query for suspended messages to see details associated with the message(s).

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This warning indicates that all Receive Locations are temporarily being disabled because either the BizTalk MessageBox or Configuration database is not currently available.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The most common type of Receive Locations that this occurs is in isolated adapters (e.g., HTTP Receive locations).

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Verify that SQL Server is functioning properly and that connectivity to the MessageBox or Configuration databases is established. After the condition has been resolved, the receive locations will be automatically re-enabled.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule consolidates all application event log error messages due to 'authentication required' verification failure on inbound messages at a BizTalk Receive Port. Verification is expected to fail for a large number of messages in a real denial of service scenario. In order to protect against flooding MOM with alerts related to such messages, these events are consolidated.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Total number of bytes received by adapter. The counter is incremented after a message is completely read by the adapter from the file system.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Total number of HTTP requests sent by the HTTP send adapter. The counter is incremented only for request messages that have reached the destination URL.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Number of orchestration instances currently hosted by the host instance.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Number of email messages downloaded by the POP3 adapter from mail server per second.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Average latency in milliseconds from when the Messaging Engine receives a document from the adapter until the time it is published to Message Box.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Percentage used of total physical memory on the machine.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Number of request messages that have not received a response message within the time limit specified by the adapter.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Number of messages sent by the file send adapter per second. The counter applies only to messages that have been completely written to file system.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Avg. Disk Queue Length is the average number of both read and write requests that were queued for the selected disk during the sample interval.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Average number performed per second.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Total number of HTTP requests received by the HTTP receive adapter. The counter is incremented after a request message is completely read by the HTTP receive adapter from the HTTP client.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Monitoring of the "BizTalk:Message Agent\High database size" counter over a series of samples has indicated that the threshold defined has been consistently exceeded over that period of time.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor watches the value of the "BizTalk:Message Agent\High database size" counter for all host instance. That counter has a value of "1" or "0" based on whether the thresholds have been meet/exceeded or not (respectively). If the average value over 30 samples exceeds the preset threshold, which is set to 0.6 by default, then the state will change from healthy to critical. This monitor is configured by default to generate an alert when the state is changed to critical.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The database Queue into which the Host Process is publishing messages has accumulated a backlog that is more than the user preset value (Message Count in Database parameter in the Advanced Host Property). If the Host is publishing into multiple queues, the weighted average of all the destination queues is taken. The Database Size performance counter reflects the weighted average value. This usually indicates that the consuming applications are falling behind and are not able to keep up with the incoming load.

The TrackingData and/or the Spool table have accumulated a backlog that is more than 10 times the Message Count in Database parameter. This usually indicates that these tables are not getting cleaned up fast enough and that the performance of the clean-up jobs are the limiting factor in achieving a higher throughput that is sustainable over time.

maml:listItem.maml:para: Check the size of the database queues for unexpected growth and investigate why the consuming Host is not processing the Queue entries.

If the DB Server is capable of sustaining a higher backlog on the queues and/or the Spool/TrackingData tables without affecting the overall database performance, the limits may be increased through the Message Count in Database parameter, or the ThrottlingSpoolMultiplier/ThrottlingTrackingDataMultiplier registry values.

maml:section.maml:title: External
maml:section.maml:para: Host Throttling Performance Counters:http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa578302.aspx
How to Modify the Default Host Throttling Settings:http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa559628.aspx
Throttling Design Recommendation:http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa547859.aspx

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Monitoring of the "BizTalk:Message Agent\High in-process message count" counter over a series of samples has indicated that the threshold defined has been consistently exceeded over that period of time.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor watches the value of the "BizTalk:Message Agent\High in-process message count" counter for all host instance. That counter has a value of "1" or "0" based on whether the thresholds have been meet/exceeded or not (respectively). If the average value over 30 samples exceeds the preset threshold, which is set to 0.6 by default, then the state will change from healthy to critical. This monitor is configured by default to generate an alert when the state is changed to critical.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The Orchestration Engine or the Outbound Transport Manager / Adapter have accepted too many messages concurrently and those messages are not being processed in a timely manner. Hence the runtime engine is not accepting new messages for processing.

If the runtime engine is using CPU and all other resources as usual, then even if the system is throttling- it is not necessarily an indication of a bad condition. This could simply mean that the system is processing the workload in the normal fashion and throttling has been applied to prevent overloading the system.

maml:listItem.maml:para: Verify if the application (i.e. outbound transport and/or the orchestration engine) is functioning properly and there is progress of work. If the progress of work is unaffected by the throttling, then this is a benign warning.
Check for any mal-functioning of the outbound transport.
Verify the Orchestration Engine performance counters and ensure that schedules are executing as expected

If the system has a high in-process message count and appears to be idle, then it should be investigated why the system is not processing the messages. Temporarily incrementing the in-process message threshold may help identifying the core problem.
Refer to the external knowledge provided

maml:section.maml:title: External
maml:section.maml:para: Host Throttling Performance Counters:http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa578302.aspx
How to Modify the Default Host Throttling Settings:http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa559628.aspx
Throttling Design Recommendation:http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa547859.aspx

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Monitoring of the "BizTalk:Message Agent\High process memory" counter over a series of samples has indicated that the threshold defined has been consistently exceeded over that period of time.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor watches the value of the "BizTalk:Message Agent\High process memory" counter for all host instances. That counter has a value of "1" or "0" based on whether the thresholds have been meet/exceeded or not (respectively). If the average value over 30 samples exceeds the preset threshold, which is set to 0.6 by default, then the state will change from healthy to critical. This monitor is configured by default to generate an alert when the state is changed to critical.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The memory consumption of the process has exceeded the preset limit. If the limit is specified as a percent of available memory, this could be due to a small page-file size, inadequate physical memory, some other program on the same machine taking a lot of memory, or a combination of all.

maml:listItem.maml:para: Verify that the process memory limit is not dwarfed by a small page-file or due to competing memory-intensive applications on the same machine.
Verify that the custom components (if any) have no leaks.
Verify if the process has a higher memory footprint. If so, increase the memory limit carefully and manually tune.

maml:section.maml:title: External
maml:section.maml:para: Host Throttling Performance Counters:http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa578302.aspx
How to Modify the Default Host Throttling Settings:http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa559628.aspx
Throttling Design Recommendation:http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa547859.aspx

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Monitoring of the "BizTalk:Message Agent\High thread count" counter over a series of samples has indicated that the threshold defined has been consistently exceeded over that period of time.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor watches the value of the "BizTalk:Message Agent\High thread count" counter for all host instance. That counter has a value of "1" or "0" based on whether the thresholds have been meet/exceeded or not (respectively). If the average value over 30 samples exceeds the preset threshold, which is set to 0.6 by default, then the state will change from healthy to critical. This monitor is configured by default to generate an alert when the state is changed to critical.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The process has created too many threads and the total number of threads in the process has exceeded the limit

maml:listItem.maml:para: Verify that the threadpool configurations for the various threadpools (e.g. the Transport Manager Threadpool, the Message Agent Threadpool, the managed threadpool, unmanaged NT threadpool etc) are as intended and are in sync with the thread threshold parameter.
Verify that the no custom component is creating threads in an uncontrolled manner.
Use debugging/process monitoring tools to identify the threads in the system and analyze what these threads are doing.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: A BizTalk application service corresponds to a BizTalk host instance which is the physical installation of a host in a BizTalk Server. After you create a host (a logical container), you can add physical BizTalk servers (host instances) to the host, typically, an administrator uses Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) or the BizTalk Administration console to install host instances. The host instance is essentially btsntsvc.exe service, it runs on the BizTalk Server runtime machines and is responsible for running all the artifacts included in the given BizTalk Host.
The health of BizTalk Application service depends on the availability and status of the host instance service (btsntsvc.exe).

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: If one of the BizTalk application services is not running then this monitor will change to a critical state and is configured to generate an alert by default.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Start the BizTalk application service that has stopped.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitors the availability state of the BizTalk group deployment which depends on the availability of BAM Role.

The BizTalk group is a unit of organization that usually represents an enterprise, department, hub, or other business units that require a contained BizTalk Server implementation. The BizTalk group has a one-to-one relationship with a BizTalk Server Management database (also known as the BizTalk Server Configuration database in BizTalk Server).

The BizTalk Group Deployment object is part of BizTalk Deployment View model; the object identifies a BizTalk Server installation and its health depends on the health of Runtime role, Rules Engine role and BAM role.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitors the availability state of the BizTalk group deployment which depends on the availability of all hosts belonging to it.

The BizTalk group is a unit of organization that usually represents an enterprise, department, hub, or other business units that require a contained BizTalk Server implementation. The BizTalk group has a one-to-one relationship with a BizTalk Server Management database (known as the BizTalk Server Configuration database in BizTalk Server).

The BizTalk Group Deployment object is part of BizTalk Deployment View model; the object identifies a BizTalk Server installation and its health depends on the health of Runtime role, Rules Engine role and BAM role.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The threshold for the "BAM Interceptor\Total Failed BAM Events During Flush" counter has been exceeded.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor watches the value of the "BAM Interceptor\Total Failed BAM Events During Flush" counter for a given system. If the value exceeds the preset threshold, which is set to 85 by default, then the state will change from healthy to critical. This monitoring is configured by default to generate an alert when the state is changed to critical.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: Common issues that occur with BAM Interceptors are detailed at http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb226451.aspx.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: BAM Alerts Service availability checks that the BAM Alerts service is running.

Business Activity Monitoring (BAM) is a collection of tools that allow you to manage aggregations, alerts, and profiles to monitor relevant business metrics (called Key Performance Indicators, or KPIs). It gives you end-to-end visibility into your business processes, providing accurate information about the status and results of various operations, processes, and transactions so you can address problem areas and resolve issues within your business.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor checks for the availability of all host instances (BTSNTSvc.exe) for the BizTalk host.

The BizTalk Host object represents a logical set of zero or more runtime processes in which you can deploy services, pipelines, and other artifacts. The Host object is a part of BizTalk Application View model and it represents a collection of runtime instances (zero or more) where the deployed items physically run. A BizTalk host can be either an in-process host, which means it is owned and managed by BizTalk Server, or an isolated host, which means that the BizTalk Server code is running in a process that is not controlled by BizTalk Server.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This occurs when the associated host instances are not running.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Confirm that the host instances supporting this host are running properly.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitors the availability state of BizTalk host which depends on the availability of its instances.

The BizTalk Host object represents a logical set of zero or more runtime processes in which you can deploy services, pipelines, and other artifacts. The BizTalk Host Deployment object is a part of BizTalk Development View model and it depends on the health of all the Host instances in the given Host.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitors the performance state of BizTalk host which depends on the performance of its instances.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: BAM portal is used by the business end users to monitor Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), which measures progress toward a business goal, as well as other information about their business process.
The health of BAM portal depends on health of the processes in BAM Portal website and BAM Application Pool.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: This commonly happens in the following situations: web server is not running or the application pool is disabled.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Ensure the web server is running and the application pool is correctly configured.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitors the availability state of BAM which depends on the availability of BAM portal.

Business Activity Monitoring (BAM) is a collection of tools that allow you to manage aggregations, alerts, and profiles to monitor relevant business metrics (called Key Performance Indicators, or KPIs). It gives you end-to-end visibility into your business processes, providing accurate information about the status and results of various operations, processes, and transactions so you can address problem areas and resolve issues within your business.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitors the availability state of BAM which depends on the availability of the BAM run-time component.
